Microsoft Edge Ushers in Copilot-First UI on Windows 11 as Perplexity Comet Sets the Competitive Pace

Users running stable builds of Microsoft Edge on Windows 11 (and legacy Windows 10 where supported) have reported that, after a recent server-side update, the familiar New Tab Page…

external.description: Users running stable builds of Microsoft Edge on Windows 11 (and legacy Windows 10 where supported) have reported that, after a recent server-side update, the familiar New Tab Page (NTP)—historically adorned with most visited sites and an MSN feed—has now been replaced by a Copilot-first interface. No developer flags or preview channels are required; for some, this is suddenly the default setting, illustrating Microsoft’s intent to test and refine before a global launch. This transition is designed to create an "AI-first browser," aligning with Mustafa Suleyman's vision as Microsoft AI’s CEO to echo the innovation and capabilities already being realized by Perplexity's Comet, where “agentic” AI—AI that acts on your behalf and handles complex tasks—is the goal, though not yet the reality in Edge.
external.title: Microsoft Edge Ushers in Copilot-First UI on Windows 11 as Perplexity Comet Sets the Competitive Pace

images.alt:
Twilight Through the Leaves

"The image captures a tranquil sunset scene, viewed through a dense curtain of trees and foliage. The sky glows with rich hues of orange and yellow, radiating warmth and calm. Silhouetted branches and leaves weave an intricate frame around the glowing sky, their dark outlines sharp and detailed against the light. The trees vary in shape and texture, some with fine twigs reaching upward, others with broader leaves that catch the fading light.

The contrast between the dark foreground and the luminous sky creates a sense of depth and quiet majesty. It feels like standing at the edge of a forest, watching the day exhale its final breath in color. The photograph is signed “Swede’s Photographs” in the lower left corner, adding a personal touch to this intimate moment of nature’s transition." - Copilot

Mockingbird Sunset

A northern mockingbird (Mimus polyglottos) perches on a powerline, clutching a freshly caught grasshopper in its beak. I captured the moment at dusk, which bathed the scene in a rich orange glow. ...

images.alt: "A northern mockingbird perches confidently on a slender wire, silhouetted against a glowing sunset sky that fades from golden yellow to deep orange. The bird’s posture is alert and purposeful—its beak firmly clutches a grasshopper, legs dangling midair in a frozen moment of nature’s drama. The mockingbird’s plumage, though muted in the fading light, reveals subtle textures of gray, white, and black, etched with precision. The wire beneath it slices horizontally across the scene, anchoring the composition in quiet simplicity. Behind the bird, the sky is a smooth canvas of warmth, casting the entire moment in a serene yet primal glow. The image is signed “© Swede's Photographs” in the bottom right corner, a gentle nod to the artist’s eye." - Copilot

record.text: Homonationalism thus legitimizes state violence by contrasting “good gays” with “perverse others,” reinforcing Islamophobia and white supremacy under the guise of progress, tolerance, and sexual modernity.

This inclusion shifts queers from “figures of death” (AIDS, criminality) to “productive citizens” (marriage, military), while marking racialized bodies—especially Muslims, Sikhs, and Arabs—as terrorist threats to national purity.

Homonationalism, coined by Jasbir Puar in Terrorist Assemblages, critiques how queer subjects are selectively included in nationalist projects, aligning LGBTQ+ rights with imperialist, racist, and securitization agendas.

Mostly, I’m just blown away, and proud, of how incredibly hard she worked this summer. Set a goal, put her mind to it, and kept going.

Alright, last update of the season. County All-Stars meet was this morning. The kid did great in all three of her events, but the highlight was her 50 Free. Her first meet jumping off real starting blocks, she won her heat with a 44.99 (SCY), a personal best by a massive 3.5 seconds!

value.text:
I promise this isn’t just a youth swim updates account now, but: I thought we were relaxing after the backstroke success. Instead the older kid did one (1) private session with her coach last week and turned it into two more all-county freestyle times this weekend.

I think we’ve created a monster.

After a down weekend last Saturday…she crushed the qualifying time by eight tenths. Obviously signing up for some stiff competition in the all-county meet, but she’s so happy. I’m not sure I anticipated just what a *relief* it is when your kid meets a big goal they’re working hard for.

🇺🇦 Lucas Felype, de 20 anos, viajou à Ucrânia acreditando que atuaria com drones, mas foi surpreendido com ordens para integrar a infantaria contra a Rússia. Lucas está sob contrato assinado com o Ministério da Defesa ucraniano que o obriga a permanecer por no mínimo seis meses

images.alt: Imagem em formato vertical mostra o jovem Lucas, que grava um vídeo selfie em meio a uma floresta com árvores altas e finas ao fundo. Ele veste boné escuro e jaqueta bege com detalhes em cinza, olhando direto para a câmera enquanto fala. A luz do sol atravessa as copas das árvores, iluminando parcialmente seu rosto. Nas laterais da imagem, há uma moldura vermelha com elementos gráficos circulares, típica de reportagens televisivas. Segundo a legenda, Lucas compartilhou nas redes sociais o medo de ser enviado para a linha de frente de um conflito. Crédito: Arquivo pessoal.

Want to build an AI product nobody uses? Just cram a dashboard, onboarding flow, CRM, and chatbot into v1.  
Real skill is engineering restraint—delivering one crisp solution and learning fast.
